name: Pano House
description:
The Pano House is a masterclass in conscious simplicity. This single-story home proves that the highest standards of bioconstruction and design can be achieved with local resources and a clear vision.
Built using the CUT system with straw bales, the house combines two roofs: a green roof that insulates the main area and a sloped tile roof that crowns the loft, optimizing both thermal performance and aesthetics. Its terrace, covered by a pergola made of local round timber, extends outdoor living, seamlessly integrating the construction into the landscape.
Self-built with knowledge:
This project was raised by its promoters, turning every straw bale and every plaster coat into an act of conscious creation and self-sufficiency.
